          Bio
          I am a PhD student in biostatistics at the University of
          Bordeaux, France. I work on new methodology for analysing
          high-dimensional molecular data in the context of vaccine
          experiments. My research interests include causal inference,
          surrogate markers, and non-parametric approaches with
          high-dimensional, low sample size applications in
          immunology.
          
          
          Education
          University of Bordeaux, France
          PhD in Public Health : Biostatistics | October 2023 -
          October 2026 (ongoing)
          University of Bordeaux, France
          MSc in Public Health Data Science | September 2022 - July
          2023
          University of Bath, United Kingdom
          Master of Mathematics | September 2018 - June 2022

          Current Offers
          
          2025
          
          Description: Proposition for a 6 month
          internship for a master’s student. The subject of the
          internship is the evaluation of individual-level surrogate
          markers of the vaccine response using supervised learning
          techniques.
          
          View
          internship offer
          
          
          
          Past Offers
          
          2024
          
          Description: Proposition for a 6 month
          internship for a master’s student. The subject of the
          internship was the identification and evaluation of
          high-dimensional trial-level surrogate markers of the vaccine
          response to yellow fever vaccination. The project was
          completed by Theodora Georgakopoulou.

          Teaching
          
            
        

        
          
      
      
        
          
          MSc Public Health Data Science – ISPED, University of Bordeaux
          
          
          Genomics Data : Generation, Management, and Analysis (2024-)
          
          Description:  In this 6 hour long course,
          I give an introduction to genomics data, focusing on the
          generation and analysis of transcriptomic data. In particular,
          I discuss
          Quality control, filtration, normalisation, and batch
          effects
          Exploratory analyses : principal component analysis,
          hierarchical clustering algorithms
          Differential gene expression analysis

          Genomics Data : Supervised Learning for High-Dimensional Data
          (2024-)
          
          Description:  In this 6 hour long course,
          I give an overview on supervised learning in the
          high-dimensional setting, focusing on regression tasks. I
          mainly discuss
          Cross-validation for model evaluation and hyperparameter
          tuning
          Regularised methods (ridge, lasso, and elastic net
          regression)
          Latent variable approaches (prinipal component regression,
          (sparse) partial least squares)
          Model interpretability

          Genomics Data : Test Multiplicity (2024-)
          
          Description:  In this 3 hour long course,
          I provide an overview of the multiple testing problem in
          high-dimensional settings. In particular, I discuss
          An introduction to frequentist hypothesis testing
          Family-wise error rate and its control (Bonferroni,
          Holm)
          False discovery rate and its control (Benjamini-Hochberg,
          Benjamini-Yekutieli)
